title: Milestii Mici 1991 Chardonnay (Moldova)
description: This aged wine has a slight bit of oxidation on the nose, with aromas of toasted hazelnuts and caramelized apple. The palate brings notes of almonds and ripe apple before the soft finish.

title: Miro 2015 Gaddis Vineyard Old Vines Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)
description: This has a dried-fruit component of plum and cherry—akin to a fruitcake in richness and flavor. Supple on the palate, it finishes in a cloud of brown sugar.

title: Napa Cellars 2015 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)
description: A confectionery nose of cotton candy and honey-baked apple permeates through the rich palate and nose of this wine. Firm in oak, it's fleshy and round with moderate acidity and a finishing touch of coconut shavings.

title: Oak Knoll 2016 Reserve White Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: A very pleasant example of this red grape made as a white wine, this is lightly fruity, with apple, green berry and lime flavors. Balanced and medium bodied, it should be enjoyed over the next two years.

title: Owen Roe 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Yakima Valley)
description: This wine's brooding aromas are not entirely settled, with fresh herb, dark cherry and anise notes. The cranberry-like fruit flavors are at once broad and tart, with lightly grainy tannins providing support. Herb notes linger on the finish.

title: Peñalba Herraiz 2015 Aptus 6 Meses en Barrica  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Cherry and dark plum aromas are solid on the nose. A raw, energetic palate is paced by bright acidity, while this tastes of blackened spice and blackberry. On a bold finish, peppery fruit flavors blend with lightly charred oak.

title: Pierre Naigeon 2015 En Pallud  (Gevrey-Chambertin)
description: Ripe cherry fruits give this wine a soft character. The tannins are there but cushioned by the generous fruit. It is a juicy, fruity wine that is developing quickly. Drink from 2020.

title: Quentin Jeannot 2016 Clos des Hâtes  (Santenay)
description: This is a rich single-vineyard wine, spiced with wood and marked by yellow and ripe white fruit flavors. A floral character adds to the immediate attractiveness of a wine that is packed with fruit and good acidity. Drink from 2019.

title: Roux Père et Fils 2016 Les Fremières  (Chambolle-Musigny)
description: This perfumed wine is fruity and crisp, offering red-berry flavors bright with acidity. Tannins are light in this charming wine with a spice and fresh fruit character. Drink from 2020.

title: Santa Barbara Winery 2016 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)
description: Properly restrained on the nose, this bottling offers aromas of chalk, honeysuckle and sliced tangerine. There is good zip and freshness to the sip, where lemon rinds and squeezed grapefruit flavors ride an energetic structure.

title: Schäfer 2015 Mettenheimer Made with Organic Grapes Pinot Noir (Rheinhessen)
description: Juicy and forward, this lavishly ripe Pinot offers loads of luscious blackberry and cherry flavors. Ripe fruit and delicate toast notes accentuate its easy, approachable style. The finish is only moderately long but framed by soft, feathery tannins. Drink now through 2019.

title: Seven Falls 2015 Chardonnay (Wahluke Slope)
description: This blend of grapes from Shaw and Jones vineyards has vanilla, papaya, banana and baking spice aromas that lead to broad fruit flavors with a lightly creamy feel. With caramel notes on the finish, it's a delightful interpretation of the variety.

title: Silvan Ridge 2016 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)
description: Not your typical Oregon Pinot Gris, this has enough leaf and grass scents and flavors to appeal to the Sauvignon Blanc drinker. Citrus peel, apple skin and spice touches add up to a textural wine with refreshing acidity. Pair it with fresh fish or prawns.

title: Tamaral 2015 Roble  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Black cherry and cassis aromas are spicy, with a sense of freshness. This Tempranillo feels tight and racy, with tension to the palate. Woody, spicy black-fruit flavors are medium in depth and a touch cooked, while this is full on the finish, with a pronounced oak flavor sticking out.

title: Torii Mor 2015 Olson Estate Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)
description: This combines old vine plantings of Pommard, Coury and 667 clones, showing some extra refinement among its mixed fruit flavors. You'll pick out lemon, orange, berry and cherry, but as with the winery's other Pinots, the acids are jagged and chalky and detract from the finish.

title: Torii Mor 2015 Yamhill Carlton Select Pinot Noir (Yamhill-Carlton)
description: This AVA designate brings a sharp focus to its brambly raspberry and other red fruit flavors. A touch of pepper and lemon zest factor in, too, leading to a tart, astringent, acid-dominated finish.

title: Uphill Vineyards 2013 Jimmy's Dream Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Amador County)
description: This wine has good natural-tasting fruit flavors and the appropriate firm tannins, plus medium to full body and a mouth-filling texture. It's a solid well-made choice in a non-oaky style wine.

title: Vincent Wine Company 2015 Chardonnay (Willamette Valley)
description: This barrel-fermented wine shows its youth through its edgy texture and just-ripe peach and apricot flavors. Aged on the lees for 18 months, it finishes clean, with light streaks of butterscotch.

title: Von Schleinitz 2016 Dry Riesling (Mosel)
description: While dry in style, this light-bodied Riesling offers loads of easy, luscious pink grapefruit and white-peach flavors. It's a fruity, forward sip without a lot of complexity, but finishes brisk and pure. Drink now through 2019.

title: Von Schleinitz 2016 Pinot Noir Rosé (Mosel)
description: Burnt sugar and caramel notes extend from nose to finish here, accenting flavors of dried red cherry and raspberry on the palate. Dry and spry, it's a straightforward yet elegant rosé expressing Pinot Noir's characteristic bramble and violet notes nicely. Drink now.

title: Weisinger 2014 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Rogue Valley)
description: This wine's blackberry and black cherry fruit is concentrated enough to match the barrel aging in one third new American oak. Light hints of charcoal accent its medium concentration and modest ripeness.

title: Weisinger 2015 Viognier (Rogue Valley)
description: Viognier has a real chance to shine in southern Oregon, and this is proof positive. Citrus zest and lemon oil notes accent its lush orange fruit, with a hint of baby aspirin. The finish keeps the grape's propensity to turn hot and bitter in check.

title: Bodega Catena Zapata 2014 Alta Historic Rows Malbec (Mendoza)
description: This wine's brambly wild berry aromas are more feral and funky than Alta usually delivers, more than likely a result of the cold 2014 vintage. On the palate, it's wiry, with raw tannins and plum and berry flavors that finish with juicy acidity and tension.

title: Bonny Doon 2016 Beeswax Vineyard Picpoul (Arroyo Seco)
description: Very light in the glass, this wine's dainty and delicate nose allows Asian pear, pear blossom and yellow rose petal aromas to show. It's even tighter on the sip, with hints of Pink Lady apple and a slightly sour pear-skin element.

title: Bouchaine 2014 Estate Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: This is a light tart wine, cradled in herbaceousness and well-defined flavors of strawberry, cranberry and rhubarb. High in acidity and subtle in oak, it has a grainy texture piquant in cardamom spice.

title: Brassfield 2014 Pinot Noir (High Valley)
description: This is a good, well-made wine with an appetizing texture, modest but tasty cherry and raspberry flavors and full body. A little cedar and cinnamon help to spice up the aroma, and firm tannins give the mouthfeel good weight.

title: Brunelli 2015  Valpolicella Classico Superiore
description: Made with 65% Corvina, 25% Rondinella and 10% Corvinone, this offers aromas of red-skinned berry, cooking spice and chopped herb. The light-bodied, juicy palate delivers red cherry, clove and licorice alongside smooth tannins. Drink soon to capture the fruit and freshness.

title: Château Marsac Séguineau 2015  Margaux
description: Linked by ownership to another Margaux estate, Tour de Mons, this wine reflects the ripe fruit of the vintage. Its tannins are still firm although they are well balanced by the bright black-currant fruit. This generous wine will be ready to drink from 2019.

title: District 7 Wines 2015 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Monterey)
description: Still tight on the nose, this well-priced bottling shows tar, black pepper, dried cherries, leather and crushed pencil aromas. The sip starts with sweetish black currant before cedary spice, black olive and wood smoke take hold. The tannins are soft and polished.

title: Domaine Chevillon-Chezeaux 2015  Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Nuits
description: Crisp and cool, this attractive wine is bright with creamed-apple flavors. It is all fruit, tangy, bright with citrus and likely to be ready to drink soon, from mid 2018.
